alert.note: Alert for Lower Iberia; Lower St. Mary; Upper Iberia; Upper St. Martin; Upper St. Mary (Louisiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Lake Charles (Southeast Texas and Southwest Louisiana)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued January 24 at 12:15AM CST by NWS Lake Charles
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT IBERIA...NORTHWESTERN ST. MARY AND NORTHWESTERN ST. MARTIN PARISHES THROUGH 100 AM CST... At 1214 AM CST, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Lydia, or near Avery Island, moving northeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to vegetation and outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... New Iberia, Catahoula, St. Martinville, Jeanerette, Avery Island, Baldwin, Loreauville, Butte La Rose, Glencoe, Lydia, Acadiana Regional Airport, Sorrel, Cote Blanche Island, Atchafalaya Welcome Center, Lake Fausse Pointe, Charenton, and Atchafalaya National Wildlife Refuge. This includes Interstate 10 in Louisiana between mile markers 121 and 126. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.

area.areaDesc: Lower Iberia; Lower St. Mary; Upper Iberia; Upper St. Martin; Upper St. Mary
